summary:
I am a data scientist with a focus on machine learning and optimization algorithms. The areas I've worked on include:

- traditional supervised learning
- unsupervised clustering
- natural language processing
- causal inference
- anomaly detection and root cause analysis
- productionizing (A/B test, MLOps)

Find my full CV @ https://www.surajiyer.com

certifications.name: Amazon ECS & Fargate Master Class - Docker on AWS
Mathematics for Machine Learning: Linear Algebra

projects.title: deeptext-lm-pretrain
projects.description:
• Pre-train BERT and exBERT language models.
• exBERT pre-trains over a specific domain with a new additive vocabulary under constrained training resources.
• Link to the paper: https://www.aclweb.org/anthology/2020.findings-emnlp.129.pdf
• Keywords: Python, Bash, Pytorch, Huggingface

projects.title: aioimap: AsyncIO IMAP client
projects.description:
• Receive e-mails from an IMAP server asynchronously and trigger a callback with the message.
• Useful to trigger smart actions based on e-mail alerts, e.g., newsletters.
• Keywords: Python, asyncio, imaplib

projects.title: Python Sync OneDrive
projects.description:
• Sync local files to OneDrive without adding them to OneDrive.
• Useful when you want to (one-way) sync a file to the cloud without changing its location locally.
• Keywords: Python, msal, watchgod

projects.title: topic-analysis
projects.description:
• Library to gain fast insights from text data with topic analysis and visualize trending topics.
• Extract noun phrases with POS tags and vectorize them with BNgrams.
• Cluster phrases with agglomerative clustering and mutual information score into topics.
• Visualize trends of generated topics over time.
• Based on the paper: Mining newsworthy topics from social media
• Keywords: Python, scikit-learn, numpy, pandas, scipy, spacy, regex, matplotlib, Phrase extraction, TF-IDF, DF-IDF, Hierarchical Agglomerative Clustering, Gaussian Mixture modeling

projects.title: Multi-view document clustering via ensemble method
projects.description:
• Python implementation of the paper: "Multi-view document clustering via ensemble method".
• Developed an ensemble model for clustering documents for topic modelling when multiple data views are available.
• Keywords: Python, pandas, numpy, numba

projects.title: Unilateral Jaccard Similarity Coefficient
projects.description:
• Python implementation of the paper "Unilateral Jaccard Similarity Coefficient".
• Useful similarity metric for documents clustering (topic modelling) case where similarity between terms cannot be assumed to be symmetric, i.e., sim(word a, word b) != sim(word b, word a).
• Keywords: Python, numpy, parallel processing

projects.title: YATrie
projects.description:
• Python Trie data structure implementation for string mapping to values and fast lookups.
• Keywords: Python

projects.title: python-data-utils
projects.description:
• Utility functions and classes for many common data science libraries.
• Collection of common algorithms and helper functions used in my Data science workflows.
• Keywords: Python, PySpark, Pandas, Numpy, Scikit-learn, Matplotlib, Statsmodels, NLP

projects.title: spacybert
projects.description:
• BERT inference for spaCy with custom extension attributes
• Provides a simple spacy compatible interface for extracting sentence embeddings from BERT model(s).
• Keywords: Python, spaCy, Huggingface, BERT, Pytorch

projects.title: spacycaKE
projects.description:
• Simple keyphrase extraction extensions and pipeline components for spaCy.
• Based on the paper: Simple Unsupervised Keyphrase Extraction using Sentence Embedding.
• Keywords: Python, spaCy, spacybert, Pytorch, Keyphrase extraction, NLP

projects.title: Graduation Thesis
projects.description:
• Research and design of algorithm based on Uplift modeling for predicting channel preference of customers to maximize conversions and return-on-investment on campaign channel usage.
• Responsible for translating business requirements of database marketeers into model design.
• Performed data analysis and feature engineering of customer channel interactions with Netezza SQL.
• Developed novel three-stage modelling framework which works well in ING operational settings.
• Keywords: Python, Scikit-learn, Azure ML, Spark, Hadoop / Hive, Bash, Netezza

projects.title: adidas Hackathon 2018
projects.description:
• Personalizing & improving next-generation shopping experience by integrating machine learning.
• Developed generative adversarial networks (GANs) to create personalized products via style transfer.
• Developed a mobile app to take pictures, send them to the prediction backend and display the returned result.
• Selected for the finals.
• Link to implementation: https://github.com/surajiyer/Adidas-Hackathon-2018
• Keywords: Python, TensorFlow, Python, IONIC, MEAN stack, Git

projects.title: Recommender Systems
projects.description:
• Tutorials on applying neural networks to information retrieval challenges.
• Using CBoW and Skipgram models to generate word embeddings for analogy detection and sentence reconstruction.
• Generate image neural codes using AutoEncoders and apply them to image retrieval.
• Using Siamese networks and RNNs to generate image and document embeddings respectively and apply them to one-shot learning tasks.
• Exercise on using Triplet network for unsupervised image-caption retrieval problem.
• Keywords: Python, Keras, Matplotlib

projects.title: Internship: ING Bank
projects.description:
• Designed a solution for predicting customer leads for the Personal Banking segment at ING Bank.
• Designed end-to-end automatic modelling framework with Spark, Hive and Bash to improve precision of predicted leads.
• Leveraged model feedback loop for continuous performance gain and to handle concept drift.
• Designed workflow simulation to provide proof of sound feedback loop (expected continuous improvement) to stakeholders.
• Designed python library to distribute scikit grid searches over spark nodes which saved significant training time.
• Keywords: Python, Spark, Hadoop / Hive, Bash

projects.title: Transfer learning with TrAdaBoost
projects.description:
• Developed a python scikit-learn implementation of the TrAdaBoost algorithm from ICML ‘07 “Boosting for Transfer Learning”.
• Exploring transfer learning as a solution to sample selection bias correction in training models on financial datasets.
• Link to the paper: http://www.machinelearning.org/proceedings/icml2007/papers/72.pdf
• Keywords: Python, Sklearn

projects.title: Trapezoidal decomposition | Computational Geometry
projects.description:
• Trapezoidal decomposition is the process of deconstructing complex shapes into simpler ones, in this case, trapezium(s). It can be used as a point-location algorithm and has more applications. 
• Implemented Randomized Incremental Construction and a Plane sweep algorithm for vertical decomposition of simple polygons into trapezoids assuming non-general position.
• Keywords: Python

projects.title: Brexit "truthifier": Building a rumor verification platform
projects.description:
Designed and developed an E2E system to collect and verify Brexit-topic related rumor tweets. 

Pipeline:
• Data acquisition: Downloading tweets. Tokenizing, building n-grams. 
• Assertion filter: segment assertions from opinions.
• Rumor extractor: Applying cluster analysis to segment tweets into rumor topics using hierarchical agglomerative clustering.
• Rumor verification: Designed features correlated with "truthfulness" of tweets. Benchmarked multiple models to assign truth score to potential rumors.
• User Analyzer: classifying users as rumor propagator or stifler.

• Responsible for data acquisition and rumor verification.
• System scores and classifies tweets well as rumors to a predefined domain.
• Model results are reproduceable, and the system can be remodelled for any predefined topic given accurate topic filters.
• Keywords: Python, Pandas, scikit-learn

projects.title: Bachelor Thesis: Software Engineering Project
projects.description:
Designed a software platform for Intuitive Technologies B.V. to integrate social components into Football club management; to share ideas and training experiences with teammates, friends, and family. ClubNet is a software system consisting of a mobile application, web interface, a server, and a database. The purpose of the ClubNet system is to assist coaches and PR (Public relations) managers at football clubs with organizing training and club related activities in an efficient manner.
• Worked on front-end development for the mobile app, notifications system, chat functionality, feed control...
• Worked on back-end for database and API development, database security, access control, frontend-backend connection...
• Designed unit and integration test cases using Mocha for a subset of functionalities including chat and feed controllers.
• Performed most of the final code debugging and worked on multiple documents including URD (User requirements document), UTP (Unit test plan), ITP (Integration test plan), SUM (Software User manual), SRD (Software requirements document)
• Agile SCRUM way of working.

★ Skills ★
Meteor, AngularJS, Ionic, NodeJS, MongoDB, Cordova, Mocha Unit testing framework

contributors.headline: Product Data Scientist at Vinted / Kleiderkreisel
Machine Learning team lead at CGTrader
Manager Data & Analytics | Process Mining Expert

projects.title: Internship: Blue Mango Greenhouse group
projects.description:
Designed models to predict Ad Click-through rate (CTR).
• Implemented a Logistic regression and Naive-Bayes model for binary classification of ad-clicks.
• Researched application of SMOTE up-sampling to solve class imbalance which was important for the business-side to evaluate.
• Achieved 59% decrease in average log-loss from 0.68 to 0.28 with simulated training data with SMOTE + random under-sampling. Results were useful to the business as this answers their hypothesis positively.
• Part of Honors Academy (Year 2)

★ Skills ★
RapidMiner, Python, scikit-learn

contributors.headline: Senior Consultant Supply Chain & Operations at EY
Sr. Machine Learning Engineer at Floryn. Favors practical software over flashy models.

projects.title: BitClass: An online classroom platform
projects.description:
It is an online anonymized education platform where anybody can teach and anybody can learn with real-time video lectures. Just create a classroom name, share the link with your students and teach.

★ Skills ★
Node.js, MongoDB, P2P video streaming with WebRTC, Express.js, ...

- Delivered production-ready code, model evaluation results and a thesis report.
- Achieved +1% uplift in online channel treatments and +17% uplift in offline channel treatments.
